div.p: N2304, no. 1302, p. 94, unit 11, VPRS 1187/P outward correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Circulars similar to this one were sent to fourteen Heads of Departments within the Chief Secretary's Department. The original letter, addressed to the Chairman of the Board of Agriculture, is no. 1302, pp. 93-4. 16 April 1866.

I am directed by the Honorable the Chief Secretary to inform you that whenever it is necessary for your Department to makea remittance to the Crown Agent,it is desirable that an account be prepared on the usual form and in the name of the Honorable the Treasurer, as the claimant, and that it be forwarded to
this office
in sufficient time to admit of its being sent to the Treasury, at least a week before the Mail closes, in a letter containing the Chief Secretary's approval of the remittance being made.
The Director of the Botanic Gardens.
